              ["panicIf(n < 0, \"n is %d and must be >= 0\", n)", [["c"]]],
              [" to provide even more descriptive message"]
            ]
          },

          "properties": {
            "language": [["Go"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "func panicIf(cond bool, args ...interface{}) {\n\tif !cond {\n\t\treturn\n\t}\n\tif len(args) == 0 {\n\t\tpanic(errors.New(\"cond failed\"))\n\t}\n\tformat := args[0].(string)\n\targs = args[1:]\n\terr := fmt.Errorf(format, args)\n\tpanic(err)\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 11
        }

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "In other words, if you implement a parser library, you should always "
              ],
              ["recover", [["c"]]],
              [" all "],
              ["panic", [["c"]]],
              [
                "s your code creates. Panic used for easier flow control should never reach the caller of your package API."
              ]
            ]
          },

          "content": [
            "50d7f204-0c57-4927-9590-683b28b6344b",
